item.title: Compañeros
item.description: Compañeros is a 1970 Zapata Western film directed by Sergio Corbucci. The film stars Franco Nero, Tomas Milian, Jack Palance and Fernando Rey. The soundtrack for the film was written by Ennio Morricone, and the orchestra was conducted by Bruno Nicolai.

item.title: Mark of Zorro
item.description: Mark of Zorro is a 1975 Italian adventure comedy film directed by Franco Lo Cascio.

item.title: One Dollar Too Many
item.description: One Dollar Too Many is a 1968 Spaghetti Western feature film directed by Enzo G. Castellari and starring Antonio Sabàto, John Saxon, and Frank Wolff.

item.title: Blindman
item.description: Blindman is a 1971 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Ferdinando Baldi. The main character is an homage to Kan Shimozawa's Zatoichi character: a blind transient who does odd jobs is in reality a high-skilled warrior.

item.title: The White, the Yellow, and the Black
item.description: The White, the Yellow, and the Black, also known as Samurai and Shoot First... Ask Questions Later, is a 1975 Spaghetti Western comedy film.

item.title: Garringo
item.description: Garringo is a 1969 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: All'ombra di una colt
item.description: In a Colt's Shadow is a 1965 Italian spaghetti western film directed and written by Giovanni Grimaldi.

item.title: Per un pugno nell'occhio
item.description: Per un pugno nell'occhio is a 1965 Italian film. It is a spaghetti western parody of Fistful of Dollars and was also known as Fistful of Knuckles and For a Fist in the Eye.

item.title: God Forgives... I Don't!
item.description: God Forgives... I Don't! is a 1967 Spaghetti Western film directed and written by Giuseppe Colizzi. The film is the first in a trilogy followed by Ace High and ended with Boot Hill.

item.title: Train for Durango
item.description: Train for Durango is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Mario Caiano.
